holidays.name: National Dress Up Your Pet Day
holidays.description: A playful day encouraging pet owners to dress their furry friends in fun costumes and share the joy (and occasional silliness) of pet fashion.
holidays.origin: Began as a lighthearted social media trend to celebrate pets and creativity in the early 2010s.
holidays.funFact: A charming annual contest for the best-dressed pet often leads to viral photos and sometimes even celebrity pet appearances!

holidays.name: Organize Your Home Day
holidays.description: A motivational day dedicated to tidying up and organizing your living space, turning clutter chaos into calm and order.
holidays.origin: Created by professional organizers to inspire people to kick-start their year with a cleaner home environment.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that organizing your home can reduce stress and boost productivity â€” so it's not just about neatness, but mental health too!

holidays.name: National Hot Pastrami Sandwich Day
holidays.description: A delicious food day honoring the classic, piled-high hot pastrami sandwich, perfect for deli lovers everywhere.
holidays.origin: Celebrated by foodies and sandwich enthusiasts in honor of this meaty, flavorful deli staple.
holidays.funFact: The pastrami sandwich rose to fame in New York Cityâ€™s Jewish delis, and some sandwiches can tip the scales at over a pound of meat!

holidays.name: Old Rock Day
holidays.description: A quirky holiday dedicated to appreciating the value and stories behind old rocks, fossils, and geological formations.
holidays.origin: Emerging from geology enthusiasts who wanted to celebrate Earthâ€™s ancient history and quirky rock collections.
holidays.funFact: Some people collect â€˜old rocksâ€™ from their youth, and the oldest known rocks on Earth are nearly 4 billion years old!
